website_summaries.verdict: For parents that want an alternative to plastic, we highly recommend them. Otherwise, choose Dr. Brown's.
pros: A traditional design made of tempered glass for precise sanitizing

customer_reviews.title: After spending way too much time I love these
customer_reviews.text: I spent way too much time over researching all these baby bottles, and lead warnings, and Bpa, and all that other crazy stuff. I finally decided on these Until I found something better and they were really cheap. They have been great they barely ever have any leaking issues. The nipples had small holes so I poked a fork in them to make them a little bigger for my older daughter. We use them all the time and they’ve never broke. Cleaning these are a breeze. Very impressed, I have ended my search for the right baby bottle after having these.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Glass bottles, yes please
customer_reviews.text: I have a few life factory bottles which are great but I was looking for more glass bottles at an affordable price. Love these bottles. I have had them for a couple months now and none have broken and they go through the dishwasher almost everyday. I did get the EVENFLO COZY GLASS BOTTLE SLEEVE to go with them which makes them easier to handle. They are a little hard to get on at first but have held up great.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. D

customer_reviews.title: Literally love these! We try to avoid plastic as much ...
customer_reviews.text: Literally love these! We try to avoid plastic as much as possible, and these bottles are great. They warm up super fast too, which is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie

customer_reviews.title: Fits breast pump perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a universal option for pumping and feeding and they are exactly that. They fit directly onto my Medela pump pieces and then when I'm done I just put a lid (the Medela lids fit perfectly) on the bottle and put it in the refrigerator. When I'm ready to use the bottle I just replace the lid with a nipple. No pouring etc., it's great! Very high quality, thick glass. I've dropped one into our quartz sink and it actually broke a drinking glass but the bottle didn't break. It's great having extra bottles to pump into and I feel much better about heating glass bottles instead of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: These bottles don’t fit Dr Browns nipples.
customer_reviews.text: Either the second set of bottles that we purchased, and the second set are different sizes than the first set, and he is no longer fit Dr. Brown’s nipples. The Bottles leaked all over the place. We are disappointed because the first order of bottles that we placed six months ago actually fit with Dr. Brown’s nipples, which is why we purchased them in the first place. We wanted more bottles, so we ordered another six, and these bottles do not fit the Dr. Brown’s nipples. If you want bottles that fit the Dr. Brown’s nipples that are glass, do not buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great bottles, bad nipples
customer_reviews.text: I love using these glass bottles because I don't have to worry about any plastic chemicals potentially leaching into my baby's milk. Also, glass is less porous than plastic, which makes these more sanitary. However, the nipples are terrible. The flow rate is inconsistent across the six nipples -- some drip and some spray like a garden hose. Losing tons of formula dripping down my baby's face instead of in his stomach. I switched to Dr Brown's #2 nipples and these are working much better.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great glass bottles!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these glass bottles!! They work perfectly with the Medela Pump In Style Advanced pump parts WITHOUT having to use an adapter. They attach right to the plastic pump piece. So happy I don't have to worry about chemicals seeping into the milk since it's glass. I already ordered more so I can store them in the freezer. My only complaint is that the lid does not screw on very tightly and if you take it with you in the diaper bag, it may leak. Make sure to put the nipple on the bottle in case you do this, and I also recommend putting it in a ziplock bag to prevent leaks in your diaper bag. Overall great bottles.
customer_reviews.author: MCL11

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, cracked
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed in both my original purchase and the replacement I ordered. Every single bottle but maybe 1 or 2 out of the dozen I ordered are cracked. From the bottom, I can run my fingernail over the crack and know for sure it's a blemish that should not be there, you can actually see where the crack is and follow it around the bottom of the bottle. They appear poorly made. I'm very disappointed. I'm sending them both back and am going to try a different brand. Guess it wasn't meant to be.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Clark

customer_reviews.title: These worked wonderfully. They were affordable
customer_reviews.text: I brought these, fearful of what experience I'd have with all the mixed reviews. These worked wonderfully. They were affordable, not one broke, and still is intact. You DO have to make sure they are twisted on , or they will leak. However, honestly I've tried so many bottles over three children and they will all leak if you don't twist them on just right. No matter what you choose you can't escape that. So these are good decent bottles, you don't really need much else. Dr. Brown nipples work with these, but their little tube inserts do NOT, I was disappointed about that.
customer_reviews.author: Momof4

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and value.
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for over a year. Broke one, when my wife dropped it from about 5 feet height onto tile. Easy to clean, they go in our diswasher. Quality glass and good bottles. I would recommend. Definitely healthier than plastic. Don't take advice from people who make moeny only when you get sick.
customer_reviews.author: GMFrancis

customer_reviews.title: The venting is poor. My baby is 9 months old and she ...
customer_reviews.text: The venting is poor. My baby is 9 months old and she was constantly stopping in the middle of feeding to let go of the nipple & let air into the bottle. I tried using the Dr Brown nipples on the Evenflo bottles, but it was still causing venting problems. Baby still had to constantly stop during feeding to let air into the bottle. I had to switch back to Dr. Brown bottles all together in the middle of feeding. She drank the whole bottle via Dr. Brown's without stopping. I really want to like these glass bottles as they are easier to clean. I may have to experiment with different nipples before I completely give up.
customer_reviews.author: T&E

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I bought the old version of these glass bottles when I had my first child. 6 years later, the bottles are still good as new. And I just got 6 more of these now that I have my 3rd baby. Love the new design of the bottle which makes it less slippery. They are very easy to clean, and each bottle comes with its own nipple. The only thing they need to improve is the number on the bottle, they are kind of hard to read. But I would still recommend these bottles as they are very durable!
customer_reviews.author: Y. Hu

customer_reviews.title: We really like these! We started with the 4 oz size ...
customer_reviews.text: We really like these! We started with the 4 oz size and moved up to this size. My daughter is exclusively formula fed so we bought two sets so we wouldn't always be scrambling for a clean bottle. We used plastic bottles with my older child that had a lot of parts to disassemble and the plastic discolored over time being washed in the dishwasher. So we opted for glass this time. They're a bit heavy, but not uncomfortable to use. I've banged them pretty hard on accident a couple of times and it hasn't harmed them. I'll probably get silicone sleeves once my daughter is old enough to start holding the bottles herself.
customer_reviews.author: KaileyMTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price?
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other glass bottles in the market these are the cheapest. These are the glass version of the $1 bottles at Walmart or any other store. The nipple is silicone nothing really special. I bought these because I wanted glass bottles because they are easier to clean. The only con these bottles are the tops. They are hard to screw on if you do it the wrong way they leak. I always check to make sure they are on the right way other than that I really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Alba Viveros

customer_reviews.title: Overall an excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I preferred glass over plastic bottles because of cleanliness. I will say to be glass these do cloud up and get stuff stuck on them way too easily and I am frequently washing them by hand and occasionally in the dishwasher so it is not that they aren’t getting clean after use. They are very heavy which can be somewhat burdening especially if baby is trying to hold the bottle himself/herself. I do like that they come with lids. Overall a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mtoddnp

customer_reviews.title: Choose this after trying multiple brands
customer_reviews.text: We choose this after trying multiple brand glass bottles. Dr Browns, Philips Avent and Medela. Our newborn didn't like any of the other bottle nipples. We also tried multiple flow nipples. But as soon as he took this he was fine. I guess we are going to stick with this. As we wanted glass only this is perfect. Also fits nicely with my wife's Medela pump so she can get rid of those medela plastic bottles. Have used these for a few days. No complaints. We wash the bottle and then use the Philips steam sterilizer.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and produces gas
customer_reviews.text: The lids are difficult to screw on so they don't leak. I know other reviewers complained about the nipples being too slow flow but my 2 week old dribbles all over from the amount of liquid coming out. It also looks like a lot of air gets into the bottle and my little one is gassy after feeding with these bottles. I like the glass for sustainability, but the rest of the design is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: QuidProQuo

customer_reviews.title: I feel very bad for myself and my son because all the breast ...
customer_reviews.text: All the bottles broke one by one when try to warm the milk, I feel very bad for myself and my son because all the breast milk i pumped for him is gone and he has to drink the formula. I expected the better quality from evenflo
customer_reviews.author: Prathyusha A.

customer_reviews.title: White plastic rings are trash, go with a different bottle
customer_reviews.text: These glass bottles are fine. I’ve been using them for about two months and haven’t had one break. Even with a baby that loves to throw them. My complaint is with the horribly flimsy and frustrating white plastic rings. They had me wishing I would have returned them and got one bottle at the same price. They don’t go on well at all & will miss thread easily, which creates a leak and therefore a mess. Annoying to deal with when you have a hungry baby.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: My little one loves these. It's the only bottles that she'll latch onto. They heat up quickly and come completely clean unlike some of our plastic bottles. I dont notice that she swallows a lot of air with these. Wish I would've bought more! Oh I almost forgot..the only negative with these is they can leak if you don't put the top on properly. I usually pull on the nipple to ensure that the nipple and the cap are sealed properly. It's an easy fix. I think the leaking is all user error.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa PhillipsTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Great glass bottle
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my twins now that they’re older and need more formula per feeding. These bottles work flawlessly with the dr brown nipples, I use the rings that came with the bottles but the DB nipples fit perfectly in them. Inexpensive and pretty bottles! I also love that they won’t warp in the dishwasher under high heat. Happy with my purchase and would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great value
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these bottles for baby. They wash and sanitize very easily in the dishwasher. I sterilize the nipples separately in a warmer. After five weeks of being used and sanitized several times a day, the nipples are starting to look a little chalky. I'll seek replacements. They heat and cool quickly and easily. Also, I found adorable bottle covers made for these on Etsy that take the chill or heat off for hands! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Pittsburgh Wife

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty glass, slow flow nipples
customer_reviews.text: The only down side to this purchase was the box it was delivered in was plain cardboard (although securely padded). I was hoping for something more giftable, but it wasn't something wrapping paper couldn't solve. The bottles themselves are heavy duty, and will hopefully hold the heat of the warmed milk longer than plastic bottles. Each came with a slow flow nipple for newborns, as the glass is probably not the best option for older babies able to hold their own bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Love these bottles! I exclusively breastfeed and bottle feed a couple times a day. We used to use the glass avent bottles however they are super pricey. These are awesome for the price! The only thing I don’t like is the nipple is really small. My 4 month olds mouth covers the entire nipple. He was able to latch onto it easily though! Medela pump also fits onto this bottle so you can pump directly into them!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best bottles ever!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these bottles! I wash them in bleach water and boil them. I've dropped 2 of them and they didn't break. My daughter is 3 months old and she's working on holding her bottle and she has no issues. Some family members told me they were too heavy for her to hold but she has no issues. I'll be buying the 8oz bottles in a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: BRITTNEY

customer_reviews.title: Bought as Dr. Brown's replacement - Not very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Bought these since they supposedly fit the original Dr. Brown's glass bottle components. Although everything screws together, it always leaks no matter how much we tighten the caps. We tried just using the Evenflo nipples and caps but the nipples were way to firm for my LO and the caps caps made of cheap plastic and are easy to cross thread. We're still using them but are not very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Emily A. Nahas

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle!
customer_reviews.text: Love these bottles! Good size. They fit perfectly with a Medela in style pump, so I can pump right into these bottles. They just seem a little fragile so I’m getting silicone sleeves for them. The nipples aren’t very soft so I use Gerber first essentials nipples and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: emilyrose

customer_reviews.title: Decent glass bottles, but terrible nipples. I wouldn’t bother with these.
customer_reviews.text: these bottles aren’t the worst, but the nipples definitely are the worst. the nipples are kind of hard and just not the right shape or size. my baby refused them. luckily the medela rings and nipples fit on these bottles, so they’re not entirely useless for us. however, i much prefer some of the other glass bottles we have over these so i’d say just buy the ones you prefer if you’re considering purchasing these because they’re cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Nice bottles, but heavy
customer_reviews.text: The eight ounce bottles are very heavy, which can be expected from durable glass. By the time my baby will need to eat 8 ounces at a time, he will probably also be able to throw the bottle and I worry it would break, so I returned these. I have the 4 ounce bottles of the same item, which I absolutely love and am basing the durability part of the review on those.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Great Bottle, But the Little Version Suffices
customer_reviews.text: These are ok, but the smaller version are the best. I find these difficult to clean at times and the smaller ones are much easier to maintain. Low quality nipple, so I would suggest ordering the Lifefactory ones in the size you need. I am a big fan of glass bottles and these are of high quality, as they can be heated without fear of breaking (or at least I never had one break in the last 6 months and I sometimes have immersed them in near-boiling water)
customer_reviews.author: Chelle

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for storage
customer_reviews.text: Wanted the tall narrow bottles for pumping into and more efficient storage. I like to use glass because fat in breast milk doesn't stick like it does to plastic. These bottles are a very heavy glass and not as smooth as other bottles, so I find them too heavy to pump into and not great for storage.
customer_reviews.author: D&N Thurston

customer_reviews.title: Not for us
customer_reviews.text: The main thing I didn’t like about these were the nipples. It took my little one foreverrrrr to finish the bottle. Even the Dr Browns size 1’s we’re quicker than this. Also, the Dr browns green sticks do not fit in the smaller version of these glass bottles. The Dr browns nipples didn’t fit either, causing a leak. Maybe it was just my little one but not a fan :( (He was 5-6 months old during the time we tried these)
customer_reviews.author: KMS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect glass bottle!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE these bottles! They are so easy to clean and I don't have to worry about anything weird leeching into my stored breast milk. Yeah the numbers on the side are a little inconvenient to read, but honestly it's not a deal breaker. I will say this to any pumping mamas: these are way heavy compared to plastic bottles. I'll find myself hunched over and resting then bottles on my thighs while I'm pumping to relieve the pulling and weight on my breasts.
customer_reviews.author: bee.hope

customer_reviews.title: Must have item
customer_reviews.text: Adore these. We use them with the Dr. Brown's nipples and parts. Love that they heat up faster than plastic bottles! Have been using the same 6 bottles daily for months and they hold up great. Can't speak to the nipples since we use the Browns, but the bottles themselves are durable and just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: Great to pump into
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Medela Pump in Style advanced so that I can pump into glass rather than plastic. Much easier to clean than plastic bottles as plastic holds soap forever times. Can use as bottles as well. Booked that came with it has a little suggest cut while and search marks on inside, therefore I use other nipples if I am going to feed from these. Wish they came with solid cap for storage. Recommend using funnel if pouring from these.
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: These are good glass bottles to use as an alternative to plastics. The measurements are clearly marked. Milk warms quickly when the bottle is placed in a cup of warm water. The bottles fit my breast pump, but they are a bit too heavy to use for pumping.
customer_reviews.author: NJMom

customer_reviews.title: Not Used for Intended Purpose, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to take milk to work for the morning cereal. Easy to clean and they hold the perfect amount for me. Topped off with Dr. Brown's Natural Flow Standard Storage Travel Caps, they provide leak-free transport.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin's Flinch

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain for glass bottles!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for glass bottles in order to avoid plastic, these are the best deal for your money! While I do like Lifefactory glass bottles because of the silicone cover, it is $15 for one whereas these are $12 for 6! You just can't beat that price. The only thing I wish is that these were wide mouth bottles because it would be so much easier to pour in formula. Now, I feel like when I go to pour a scoop of formula into the bottle, a lot of it doesn't fit inside and gets all over the bottle/counter. Other than that, I love these and bought both the 4oz and 8oz.
customer_reviews.author: Britney B.

customer_reviews.title: Great bottles!
customer_reviews.text: Great bottles! Can't find a single complaint about them. I'll never use another bottle again. They should be charging more for these bottles, I bought ONE glass bottle of a different brand, and spent more on that one bottle than I did on 6 of these. Definitely a great buy and I would buy these over and over again. Also, when I decided to do glass bottles, I was worried that they might break or crack. No problem here! I have hard floors and have dropped them from a standing position and not a single crack, shatter or break! I was pretty impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson's

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing - quality has gone down
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap, and we like glass bottles. We bought a pack of 6; only 5 came in the box. We were too lazy to return them or complain about them, so we kept using them. It's been over 2 months, and 2 have broken in the bottle warmer, resulting in quite a mess. We actually used Evenflo 5 years ago and were happy with them then, but I think the quality has gone down.
customer_reviews.author: Van Tran

customer_reviews.title: These Bottles are Awesome and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of plastic bottles- they get smelly and gross. These glass bottles are awesome! They are sturdy, good quality, easy to use and clean. The best part is the price! Most other brands you get only one or two for the price of 6 of these. My daughter takes the evenflo nipple with no problem but even if she didn't, they are compatible with other brands if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Bourque

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome! I started a bit late with the glass ...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I started a bit late with the glass bottles (I used medela bottles and pump) so I just use the medela tops and nipples instead of the ones the bottles came with. I also use a medela pump n style and can pump directly into these bottles! I love it :) definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: Natural tempered glass. Durable, washable doesn’t stain
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality. Thick tempered glass. The bottles work with medela lids and pumps. Very random yet pleasant coincidence. Quick in warming up milk right from fridge. One draw back is that if you are using formula; the top part diameter is very close to the one of a measuring spoon, so things can get messy.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Best Glass Baby Bottles!!
customer_reviews.text: The best glass bottles on the market. The perfect shape. Not too big that you can't hold it firmly and not too small. The design has the perfect grip. Easy to clean and feels truly sterilized when using hot water. I love glass bottles for babies!!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Glass bottles are great for a baby. These are very thick also.
customer_reviews.text: Must buy bottles. Got my niece away from the plastic bottles as they are very bad for the baby. Petrochemicals leach off the plastic of bottles, cups, plastic bags. They interfere with hormones. Plastics are very bad for anyone especially a baby.
customer_reviews.author: heart 2 heart huggers

customer_reviews.title: ( but I still like them better than the 8 oz - more practical ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish they were 5 oz, instead of 4 :( but I still like them better than the 8 oz - more practical for me, and, on the other hand,they're more than worth the price, as i'm not willing to pay double to triple for the extra oz other brands offer (I wish Dr Brown hadn't discontinued the 5 oz original glass bottles - the slimmer ones, not the bulky ones you find nowadays). And no, you cannot fill them with 5oz, only about 4.5-4.7 oz.
customer_reviews.author: Flori

customer_reviews.title: Great Price & Quality
customer_reviews.text: Most bang for your buck! You can’t beat the price for 6 bottles. Best part is they are super easy to clean and not heavy at all. Definitely easier to maintain than plastic bottles. I purchased silicone sleeves separately and they have been working great on my newborn. Bottles come with everything. Pretty bottles, price is prettier, packaging is perfect, quality is superb. Will definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: So handy
customer_reviews.text: I love these bottles. I bought silicone sleeves to go with them which has helped. I've even dropped them a few times and haven't even gotten a crack. I throw the bottles in the top rack of my dishwasher and they come out sparkling and ready to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Leonna Elam

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning and Tough
customer_reviews.text: I am a forgetful father and sometimes I forget to clean the plastic bottles right and they get really messy when the formula gets stuck inside making it near impossible to clean these bottle are way easier to clean than plastic. Impressed I was looking for a bottle that wasn't hard to clean. In addition these bottles are tough I was nervous at first of course because it's glass but I ensure you these bottles are tough my 6 month old even dropped one in the kitchen and it still did not break or chip
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh919

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bottles
customer_reviews.text: Love these glass bottles for my little one, especially when I use the bottle warmer to warm up breastmilk. I feel at ease knowing that no chemicals from the plastic bottles is melting and mixing in with my milk. I do use the Dr. Browns filter and cap/nipple and it works wonderful, much better than the original tops the bottles come with. The white tops were difficult to twist on evenly but I prefer the Dr Browns regardless because of minimizing air bubbles. Definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: MB1985

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I bought this type with my first child, just bought some more. Love these, only thing is they don't vent so nipple will eventually collapse, most remove from babes mouth. Not a deal breaker for me the glass bottle and nipple shape were more important to me.
customer_reviews.author: K.O.

customer_reviews.title: Basic bottles
customer_reviews.text: I prefer glass bottles because they are easy to clean. They may be heavier than plastic but they are durable (I’ve never had one break) and the texture makes them easy to use. There’s nothing fancy about them, but I like that!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Needed good cheap glass bottles for my babies and these are ...
customer_reviews.text: Needed good cheap glass bottles for my babies and these are excellent. My twin girls got picky about their bottles at about 4 months old and only wanted the hospital rubbery nipples and they fit these bottles. It’s the only bottle I use now. However they don’t like the nipples that came with them, I think it’s how slippery they are, like I said my girls prefer the rubber ones.
customer_reviews.author: Twin mom

customer_reviews.title: Good for Kids
customer_reviews.text: It is great replacement of plastic bottles. One of my friend suggested me. I have been using from 1 week with dr brown nipples they are really good. Best thing is it fits dr brown nipples and parts.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Great durable bottles and a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly with the Dr. Brown inserts with the white rubber piece that sit on top of the bottle. However, its too snug for the green inserts that you push into the bottle. The opening cuts off the air flow for the inserts and so the milk doesn’t flow right. The glass is thick like a mason jar and durable. Top rack dishwasher safe! By nine months my son was able to hold the bottles with ease even though they are a bit heavier than the plastic, which is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: OMG love these bottles!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these bottles, I'm someone who hates plastic bottles and with past babies I would pay dearly for glass bottles, so when I found these on Amazon I couldn't believe how cheap they were yet the quality is FANTASTIC. I love the size for smaller babies, easy to hold for feedings. My son likes the nipples they are easy for him to drink out of at even just a day old (past babies I often had to add holes to nipples to help the flow). Definitely recommend for anyone wanting glass bottles to buy a set of these
customer_reviews.author: Ally Apples

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the cleanliness of glass
customer_reviews.text: We're about to have our 3rd baby and these glass bottles have been the only bottles we've used. I breastfeed and pump, these fit the Medela breastpump which I found extremely helpful. I would pump directly into the bottle and feed my children. With glass, smells don't really stick so even if I accidentally left milk in there for too long and it spoiled you wouldn't even be able to tell after being washed. I really love these bottles!
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: The bottle caps are very poorly designed... ...
customer_reviews.text: The bottle caps are very poorly designed...they don't screw on smoothly and are very poorly fitted. Lost so much pumped breastmilk with these bottles because of the poorly fitted bottle caps.
customer_reviews.author: Teddi

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Must have for you baby. Kind of heavy but super easy to clean, hard to break, don’t have to worry about chemicals from plastic, very easy to order more nipples for these from amazon, very reasonably prices, a lot of different nipples can fit the tops of these bottles!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great glass bottles!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been trying to steer clear of all the plastic bottles. The chemicals in the plastics(bpa, etc) leeching into the milk are a big concern for us. There are so few quality glass bottles on the market. Glass is more sanitary because it is less porous than plastic. Making them easier to clean and less likely to have bacteria build up. These bottles are comfortable to hold and have silicone nipples. I recommend these for any health conscience parents.
customer_reviews.author: JoeRodge

customer_reviews.title: They break super easy
customer_reviews.text: These bottles were great for the first 3 weeks, but as others have stated don't warm them up in a bottle warmer. They will break. It makes the biggest mess. We've had 4 of our 6 break.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy H.

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes leak? Otherwise great.
customer_reviews.text: I was gifted 6 of these bottles. They are fantastic! I accidentally stained the nipples and rings in the dishwasher with tomato sauce and they are stained a little orange. I ordered 6 more. The old (orange) ones NEVER leak. The new (still white!) ones sometimes leak and you have to unscrew the cover, wipe it all down, and hope that stopped the leak. Overall, I love these bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Zach and Amanda Cooper

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY! Easy to clean and durable!
customer_reviews.text: We love these glass bottles! We had never used glass with our first child, but figured I would give it a go with this second baby since this is a good deal. We have been using them for almost 4 months now and they have been wonderful! They clean so much easier than any plastic bottle could and they are very durable. We have dropped them a couple times and none have chipped or broken. I highly recommend using these!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Urban

customer_reviews.title: Easiest bottles to clean ever.
customer_reviews.text: Best bottles I’ve ever owned! Super easy to clean, adorable, old fashioned yet modern. I love these! Dropped it on the concrete floor at the doctors office and I thought for sure it cracked or chipped. Nope! I had even forgot the silicone protectors at home! I bought those separately, although I don’t think I actually needed them. I was worried because these are glass. They are very durable bough!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Love these bottles! The nipples are the only ones my son would take. They're also interchangeable with the other Evenflo bottles I have which is great! My only complaint is they are pretty heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bottles if you don't want plastic, but can't afford a $20 glass bottle. Very easy to clean and mendela caps work on them. My baby initially was collapsing the nipple, but he learned in a couple days how to drink from them without doing that at a couple months old. I just watched and would fix it each time.I have also dropped them twice with no breaks or cracks.
customer_reviews.author: bellablue

customer_reviews.title: these are the perfect price. I had originally bought a 3 pack ...
customer_reviews.text: For glass bottles, these are the perfect price. I had originally bought a 3 pack for the same price at a local baby store. I was extremely upset that they sell them in a six pack for the same price here. They are heavy duty and arrived without chips. I bought a different brand and I don't think the extra $15 that my friend paid was worth anything since the bottles seem exactly the same. I definitely recommend just buying these cheaper in price ones because the quality is totally there.
customer_reviews.author: Joaquin Labrado

customer_reviews.title: Safe, simplistic, economical, and great for pumping
customer_reviews.text: After investing in a variety of glass and plastic bottles (some being far fancier), these have become my go-to. They're perfect to use with standard pumps, have a nice grip to them, and obviously far safer than even "BPA-free" plastics (which still leach various chemicals). My only slight complaint is that a few have broken fairly easily from shallow drops - but most of my glass is uber-strong borosilicate, so it could be my frame of reference. Oh, and I never experienced any issues with the nipples. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: excellent bottles, not great nipples
customer_reviews.text: these are the only bottles i use anymore because they are glass, and i try to limit the amount of plastic we come in contact with. i give them four stars because the nipples are not that great - some seem to leak, and the flow of milk is inconsistent. i get around this by using the nipple and ring from a medela bottle, which fits perfectly on these bottles. i considered buying the lifefactory glass bottles, but for less than the price of one of them, i got six of these.
customer_reviews.author: jillian of the woods

customer_reviews.title: I love these bottles!
customer_reviews.text: These bottles are amazing! So easy to clean, they don't scratch or hold stains like plastic, and they're much easier to sanitize. At first I was worried about giving a glass bottle to a baby, but I've dropped one myself a time or two, and it didn't break. (I'm not claiming that they're unbreakable, I've just never broken one.) They have a standard size opening, and fit both breast pumps I have, Ameda and EvenFlo, which makes pumping and saving pretty convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Try something else.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t normally write these... likes the bottles initially, and they didn’t leak. The problem I ran into was we used a bottle warmer, and when I picked up the bottle, to give it a quick shake, the bottom broke out and got milk all over our carpet. Cheaply made? It wasn’t even very hot, and we didn’t put cold liquid into it. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bitner

customer_reviews.title: Leaky
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to use these but EVERY single bottle leaks when I feed baby. And not just a little, enough to soak her in a matter of seconds! There must be a problem with the plastic ring that screws onto the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Nataly

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: This product can't be plsced in a bottle warmer. The bottom of the bottle will literally pop ogg. These are not the same quality as the evenflo glass bottles of the past. The rim of the cap and bottle only has two layers, verses three or four which does not allow for proper adjusting for flow.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE... EXPLODE
customer_reviews.text: I’m very upset to inform that three bottles broke after we took them from the sterilizer, thinking it was something we did, we purchased more bottles only to have one of them explode while warming! Imagine the distress of dealing with a hungry baby, an upset momma over the spilled milk and worrying that the dog wouldn’t step on the glass, not to count the mess it made. What a shame! What a dangerous thing! What if it had happened while feeding? This is absolutely unacceptable. Those bottles are dangerous, do not purchase them.
customer_reviews.author: seethr

customer_reviews.title: Glass is durable, rings warp
customer_reviews.text: The glass is durable and doesn't break when it falls on the tile floor. However, the bottle rings warp and the top leaks occasionally. Super frustrating when my precious pumped milk is all over my son's shirt, rather than in his belly. That being said, I'd try to find new bottle rings rather than buy new bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Loved them!
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed to mix our formula in then to refrigerate. I didn't want plastic bottles when mixing formula. After the boiled water cooled for 5 minutes we mixed in the formula, then refrigerated. Once they are cooled you can transfer the formula to a bpa free bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Broken Glass!! Get the protection cover with it
customer_reviews.text: Love these glass bottles. Suggested improvements: make glass lighter, they're quite heavy for little hands. Include a protection cover with this set, I think it's a bit ridiculous that one SINGLE cover is almost the same price as this whole set. Danger: glass bottle broke after accidental drop and glass pieces went everywhere! Pretty scary. If you are going to buy this. Might as well get the protection cover.
customer_reviews.author: Momma263103

customer_reviews.title: Works with dr brown parts!
customer_reviews.text: Love these glass bottles! They work with the dr brown parts and they are glass so it’s safe to warm milk in them. They are much more inexpensive then the dr brown bottles. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Really great but heavy
customer_reviews.text: These are really great bottles and I recommend them heartily, just be aware that because they are glad they are much heavier than plastic bottles. So if you have wrist problems, don't get them. Otherwise these are really great bottles!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE these bottles
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE these bottles. We used Dr. Browns for baby's first two months.. what a mistake. Half the milk in bottle dripped onto his bib and shirt.... to the point of drenching his shirt!!! It wasn't until we bough Evenflo that we realized what a piece of junk the Dr. Brown bottles were. With the new bottles, not even a drop of milk falls onto his chin. I mean, I actually feel guilty I didn't have this earlier for our baby.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Started feeding with my first child with glass bottles and I absolutely love them I couldn't imagine using plastic one less chemical to put my child's body. I've had them dropped from a car I've had them dropped out of the car on to the asphalt. I was washing one in the sink and I dropped it and it hit the rim and it shattered and it did shatter in to pretty small pieces but then again it's glass and that's to be expected overall awesome deal and I'd buy them again and I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great glass bottles
customer_reviews.text: I love these bottles so much that I bought two sets. I love how they're glass so I don't have to worry about chemicals leaching into the milk. These bottles are the ones my baby prefers too over Comotomo, Advent Philips, and Playtex VentAire. I could have saved some money if I just stuck to these glass bottles originally, but I wanted to try other brands.
customer_reviews.author: xriariceex

customer_reviews.title: Flows way too fast
customer_reviews.text: i really wanted to like these and I saw all the good reviews, but they didn’t work well for us. There’s no venting system on these and when you heat the bottles and tip them upside down the pressure inside is so strong that they continually squirt milk out even with the smallest nipple.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are great I like to use glass bottles for newborns so there is no bpa. these bottles comes well packaged to ensure none brake during shipment . all bottles come with caps too.
customer_reviews.author: Amorette

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for about 2.5 months and love them! They are compatible with dr browns parts so that’s what I have been using. They do not break easily as I have knocked them over several times. They also warm breastmilk up faster than plastic bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Hiep

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I love these bottles! We only use glass baby bottles for a variety of reasons-- they are a far superior to plastic. The only downside is they can be quite a bit pricier than their plastic counterparts. These cost just as much as plastic bottle sets but are glass! I have dropped several in our stainless steel sink and not one crack! Even if one were to break they are super affordable, and you can buy silicone covers. Also you can fit a variety of nipples in the rings AND the rings fit on similac ready to go bottles. So this has been a great/versatile investment!
customer_reviews.author: EEK

customer_reviews.title: Nice glass bottle
customer_reviews.text: The flow has been good and they're reasonably easy to clean. We had 1 bottle break, not a huge deal. We've been using the rest for months. I definitely prefer these to plastic bottles!
customer_reviews.author: Juniper Wright

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy bottles that have stood up to the dishwasher and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy bottles that have stood up to the dishwasher and very hot tap water. No drops yet as the parents are holding hte bottle and feeding an infant. We have used them by solo and with a silicon sleeve -  We have not tried to use the supplied nipples yet. Dr. Brown's Natural Flow Standard Storage Travel Caps fit perfectly if you don't want to bother with the 2-piece travel cap (screw cap in conjunction with inverted nipple) -
customer_reviews.author: Lovolt

customer_reviews.title: Great bottles
customer_reviews.text: I like the convenience of the glass bottles. I use them for different purposes. The primary purpose is for my baby’s feeding. I can prepare his bottles with milk in advance and store the bottles in the refrigerator. I can put the bottle in the bottle warmer to warm the milk. In the case that the bottle get too hot, I can easily cool the bottle by running cold tap water on it. The second purpose of using the glass bottles is to store some MCT oil. Whether there is milk or MCT oil in the bottle, the bottles are very easy to clean and air dry.
customer_reviews.author: Fight Like a Preemie

customer_reviews.title: Thick glass
customer_reviews.text: I like the heavy glass feel of the bottles and the way it keeps the breast milk fresh. I didn’t like the gas that it caused my son to have so unfortunately I’m switching bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Angeleyes JP

customer_reviews.title: Collapsing nipple
customer_reviews.text: I really really wanted to love these bottles. They work but there is one flaw that prevents them from getting 5 stars from me.... The lid. If you put it on just barely too tight the nipple collapses. You have to find the sweet spot between leaking everywhere and collapsing...
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Williamson

customer_reviews.title: THese are the best. We have many fancy bottles but these work ...
customer_reviews.text: THese are the best. We have many fancy bottles but these work very well. I like glass vs plastic. I was worried 6 wouldn't be enough for feedings and storage but it is sufficient. You can store extra milk in jam jars, we even used a bottle from Nestle coffee. I wish evenflo sold same bottles for storage without a nipple end.
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: These arrived in perfect condition, and I feel like I got a great value. I'm using these for a baby bottle chugging contest at my sister-in-law's baby shower, so I cannot yet confirm as to how well they "suck" lol. But please feel free to steal my idea! Should be a hit.
customer_reviews.author: nikkimags

customer_reviews.title: Leaks when you shake the bottle
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to try these for my baby boy when I got them last night. I'd been wanting glass bottles with silicone nipples (that aren't the wide base kind). But they leak when you shake them with the cap on, which I need to do with formula. :( Giving two stars because it's a good deal, the nipples work okay, and it doesn't leak just for feeding, but the leaking when shaken is kind of a deal breaker. Maybe I got some defective ones? But that happened with two bottles that I've already tried.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wei

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have a busy life working 40 hours a week and dealing with a 8 month old I often forgot to wash the bottles right way. Plastic bottles are really hard to clean unless you clean them right away these glass bottles clean with a breeze. They also are strong and dutiable my child even dropped the glass on the kitchen floor and it didn't no break.
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh919

customer_reviews.title: They Leak
customer_reviews.text: No matter how I twist it tighten the lid, these bottles leak. Can be very frustrating. However, I do love how easy they are to clean and assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: Missing a bottle
customer_reviews.text: When my package arrived it was short one bottle but due to the urgency and chaos of the time of my life I wasn’t able to return them as I needed them NOW.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Love the item, hate the price increase!
customer_reviews.text: I really love these bottles. They keep my breast milk fresher than the plastic ones. They are so durable (I have dropped them in the sink and they haven't cracked). I purchased the Dr. Brown's twist tops to go with these bottles. I am not a fan of the two piece tops you get with the other storage bottles. It was so frustrating when I came back to buy more 3 days later and the price increased by $8! I ended up buying my second set somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Weakening
customer_reviews.text: Bottles are starting to crack after two months of use. One bottle has developed stress fractures after sterilization. We only sterilize the bottles once every two weeks. They’re supposed to be tempered glass, so I’m not sure why this is happening.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with Medela In Style
customer_reviews.text: Glass bottles that are compatible with the Medela In Style pump! I screwed these directly into my pump, so I didn't have to use any plastic bottles ever. Got so much use out of these when I was breastfeeding!
customer_reviews.author: Clare Fracassi
